Introduction to Variables

Variables are containers for storing data in a program. Each variable has a type that defines what kind of data it can hold.

Example of integer and character variables:

#include <stdio.h>

int main() {
    int age = 20;
    char grade = 'A';
    printf("Age: %d, Grade: %c\n", age, grade);
    return 0;
}

Key points:

  • Variable names must start with a letter or underscore.
  • C is case-sensitive (Age â‰  age).
  • Always initialize variables before using them.
